labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Chronos" is designed to facilitate interactions with the Stellar blockchain through AI assistants. It provides tools for wallet connections (connect_wallet), token management (list_tokens), balance queries (get_balances), and fund transfers (transfer_funds). These tools focus on blockchain operations and financial transactions within the Stellar ecosystem, promoting seamless integration with AI applications.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around Stellar blockchain interactions. The secondary label "Financial Services" is added due to the focus on fund transfers and balance management, while "API Integration" is relevant given the server's modular architecture and deployment for use with AI assistants. The analysis indicates no need for a custom label as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality well.

server_info_crawled.name: Chronos
server_info_crawled.author: @christopherkarani/chronos-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable your AI assistant to interact seamlessly with the Stellar blockchain by connecting wallets, listing tokens, querying balances, and transferring funds. Simplify blockchain operations with easy deployment and integration into AI applications like Claude Desktop. Extend functionality with a modular architecture designed for future enhancements.

tools.name: connect_wallet
tools.description: Deploy Server @christopherkarani/chronos-mcp Try in Playground connect_wallet

tools.name: list_tokens
tools.description: List all tokens in a Stellar wallet

tools.name: get_balances
tools.description: Get balances for all tokens in a Stellar wallet

tools.name: transfer_funds
tools.description: Transfer funds to another Stellar wallet

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@christopherkarani/chronos-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
